de.esoco.lib.event

Class EventMulticaster<E extends Event<?>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.esoco.lib.event.EventMulticaster<E>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    EventHandler<E>, EventListener

    public class EventMulticaster<E extends Event<?>>
extends java.lang.Object
implements EventHandler<E>
    An event handler implementation that chains multiple event handlers and propagates incoming events to all registered handlers. Works similar to the AWT event multicaster.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      EventMulticaster(EventHandler<E> rFirst, EventHandler<E> rSecond)
      Creates a new instance that wraps two event listeners.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static <E extends Event<?>>
      EventHandler<E>      		 add(EventHandler<E> rFirst, EventHandler<E> rSecond)
      A static method to concatenate two event listeners by means of event multicaster instances, thus building a tree of multicaster instances and listeners.
      void handleEvent(E rEvent)
      Dispatches the given even to all event handlers in the tree of event multicasters that starts at this instance.
      protected EventHandler<E> remove(EventHandler<E> rToRemove)
      Recursively removes a certain event listener from this multicaster (sub)tree and returns the resulting event listener (which may be a multicaster).
      static <E extends Event<?>>
      EventHandler<E>      		 remove(EventHandler<E> rListener, EventHandler<E> rToRemove)
      A static method that removes an event listener from a tree of multicaster instances.

    • Constructor Detail

      • EventMulticaster

        public EventMulticaster(EventHandler<E> rFirst,
                        EventHandler<E> rSecond)
        Creates a new instance that wraps two event listeners.
        Parameters:
        rFirst - The first listener of this multicaster
        rSecond - The second listener of this multicaster

    • Method Detail

      • add

        public static <E extends Event<?>> EventHandler<E> add(EventHandler<E> rFirst,
                                                       EventHandler<E> rSecond)
        A static method to concatenate two event listeners by means of event multicaster instances, thus building a tree of multicaster instances and listeners.
        Parameters:
        rFirst - The first listener to concatenate (may be NULL)
        rSecond - The second listener to concatenate (may be NULL)
        Returns:
        The resulting event listener which may be a multicaster instance

      • remove

        public static <E extends Event<?>> EventHandler<E> remove(EventHandler<E> rListener,
                                                          EventHandler<E> rToRemove)
        A static method that removes an event listener from a tree of multicaster instances. If the given listener isn't part of the tree the call will have no effect.
        Parameters:
        rListener - The listener (tree) to remove the other listener from
        rToRemove - The listener to remove (NULL will be ignored)
        Returns:
        The resulting event listener which may be a multicaster instance

      • handleEvent

        public void handleEvent(E rEvent)
        Dispatches the given even to all event handlers in the tree of event multicasters that starts at this instance.
        Specified by:
        handleEvent in interface EventHandler<E extends Event<?>>
        Parameters:
        rEvent - The event that occurred
        See Also:
        EventHandler.handleEvent(Event)

      • remove

        protected EventHandler<E> remove(EventHandler<E> rToRemove)
        Recursively removes a certain event listener from this multicaster (sub)tree and returns the resulting event listener (which may be a multicaster).
        Parameters:
        rToRemove - The listener to remove
        Returns:
        The resulting event listener which may be a multicaster instance
